events.description: Release of January CPI and core inflation data for the eurozone.
The European Central Bank's scheduled meeting to decide on interest rates.
The yield on Italy's 10-year benchmark bond falling below 3.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: Italy’s 10-year BTP yield slipped further below 3.5%

facts.fact_text: Eurozone CPI slowed to 1.7% in January.

evidences.evidence_text: Eurozone CPI slowed to 1.7% in January, comfortably below the ECB’s target

facts.fact_text: Eurozone core inflation fell to 2.2%, the lowest since October 2021.

evidences.evidence_text: core inflation unexpectedly fell to 2.2%, its lowest since October 2021
In Italy, inflation eased to 1.0%, the lowest level since October 2024.

claims.claim_text: A stronger euro could lead to a resumption of interest rate cuts.

evidences.evidence_text: raising concerns that a stronger euro could trigger a resumption of rate cuts paused in June

claims.claim_text: The ECB is expected to maintain current interest rates.
claims.author: Market consensus

evidences.evidence_text: The ECB is widely expected to keep rates unchanged for a fifth consecutive meeting

claims.claim_text: Christine Lagarde will likely state that monetary policy is currently appropriate.
claims.author: Market analysts

evidences.evidence_text: ECB President Christine Lagarde is expected to reaffirm that monetary policy remains in a “good place”

claims.claim_text: Interest rates are expected to remain steady through 2026.
claims.author: Money markets

evidences.evidence_text: money markets anticipate rates will remain steady through 2026

evidence.evidence_text: Italy’s 10-year BTP yield slipped further below 3.5% as markets reacted to weaker eurozone inflation data
raising concerns that a stronger euro could trigger a resumption of rate cuts
markets reacted to weaker eurozone inflation data ahead of the European Central Bank's decision
